result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy Michael Okeefe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (7th), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay all of the following by end of supervision:  Fine in amount of $1.00,  DNA surcharges, Court costs.   To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
All applicable fees of supervision.

04-25-2017/ Judge Dennis Cimpl 
The Court ordered count one shall be amended to state that the sentence is consecutive to count two.  Count two shall be amended to state that the sentence is consecutive to any other sentence
Consecutive to: to count two  
Credit to be detemined.
Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving two (2) years of Initial Confinement.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain full time employment.

No further violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No driving a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.

Cooperate with the probation department and any probation recommended treatments.
Manage his diabetes.
AODA assessment. Cooperate with any treatment programs deemed necessary.  Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes: Defendant's operating privilege for operation of Class D vehicles is restricted to operating vehicles that are equipped with an ignition interlock device; and each motor vehicle for which the defendant's name appears on the vehicle's certificate of title or registration must be equipped with an ignition interlock device beginning on the date the department issues any license and for a period of three (3)  years thereafter.
Court Order for IDP Related Offense Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan signed and filed.

Provide a DNA sample.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm; also advised that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Consecutive to: Consecutive to  any other sentence.  

To be served in the Wisconsin Prison system.

records.addlTxt: Count one.
Count two.

Defendant Timothy Michael Okeefe in court with attorney Robin Shellow.  Defendant Timothy Michael Okeefe in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 
As to Count 1:  the Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  7 YEARS with credit to be determined; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 4 YEARS.
As to Count 2:  the Court sentenced the defendant to 1 year to be served in the Wisconsin Prison System CONSECUTIVE to Count 1
These sentences to run consecutive to any other sentence.
Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and the WI Substance Abuse program after serving 2 years of initial confinement.
  Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- No further violations rising to the level of probable cause
- Cooperate with the Probation Department
- Cooperate with any Probation recommeded treatments
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment programs deemed necessary
- manage his diabetes
- Random urine screens
- Seek and maintain full-time employment
- Provide a DNA sample.
- No driving a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license
Court orders no other specific programming conditions.  Defendant must complete a risk and needs assessment with DOC and comply with case plan goals related to prioritized need areas so identified.

Court ordered defendant's operating privileges revoked for 3 years with the mandatory reinstatement fee.  
Defendant's operating privilege for operation of Class D vehicles is restricted to operating vehicles that are equipped with an ignition interlock device; and each motor vehicle for which the defendant's name appears on the vehicle's certificate of title or registration must be equipped with an ignition interlock device beginning on the date the department issues any license and for a period of  3 years thereafter.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Pay fine in the amount of $1.00
Restitution in the amount of zero
Pay DNA surcharges
Pay court costs
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter
-  The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Court ordered Intoxicated Driver Assessment form

Attorney Robin Shellow in court, defendant Timothy Michael Okeefe not in court, in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared by Patrick Anderson for the State of Wisconsin. from defense counsel Robin Shellows to re-schedule the 9/28/2015 sentencing hearing to 10/16/2015 at 1:30 pm.

Per the ADA the there was an error and submitting the paperwork to produce the defendant for tomorrow's proceedings. Case was adjourned with the input of both parties. Sentencing will be held on 09/28/2015 at 1:30.

Attorney Robin Shellow in court, defendant Timothy Michael Okeefe not in court, in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for Sentencing hearing, however defense attorney is in trial elsewhere.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
At the request of the defense, and without objection from the Court or the State, sentencing hearing is moved from 05/12/2015 to 06/22/2015 at 8:30am.

Defendant Timothy Michael Okeefe in court with attorney Robin Shellow.  Defendant Timothy Michael Okeefe in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for final pre-trial, however parties would like to proceed with a plea hearing instead.  Jury trial date of 04/06/2015 is vacated.
As to Counts 1 & 2:
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 22.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 12, 2015 at 10:00 am.

As to 14CF427 and 14TR147, along with Restitution Worksheets, FILED, in case number 14CF427

Defendant Timothy Michael Okeefe in court with attorney Jerome F Pogodzinski.  Defendant Timothy Michael Okeefe in custody.  Thomas L Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
AS TO COUNTS 1 and 2, Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  PSI was NOT ordered. Case set for sentencing in Branch 22.Sentencing hearing scheduled for 05-29-2014 at 01:30 pm.
With all terms and conditions previously set, still in place.

Attorney Jerome F Pogodzinski in court, defendant Timothy Michael Okeefe not in court, in custody.  Thomas L Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Plea and Sentencing scheduled for a later date in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 04-14-2014 at 08:30 am.
